title: #139: "False Report" RCP Book Club
description:
Lisa Zambetti is joined by Dean Laffan to discuss the book detailing the true story of Marie, a teenager who was charged with lying about being raped and the detectives' journey to arrive at the truth in the hunt for a serial rapist who was terrorising women. 


In 2008 a young woman reports rape in Seattle. She is not believed and was given a citation for false reporting. She was forced to pay $500 fine and plead guilty to lying about being raped. A series of rapes then began in Colorado. 


The victims ranged from young women to a grandmother. He was a predatory stalker who spent months researching each victim. He would break in, brutally rape the women, take photos on occasions and then carefully clean everything afterwards. He was prolific and predatory and sadly there will no doubt be many more victims who suffered at this hands, than the crimes with which he was charged.


There are a lot of lessons to be learned about believing victims when they take the brave decision to report and many more about early identification, intervention and prevention. 


FALSE REPORT by T. Christian Miller and Ken Armstrong: A New York Times Book Review Editors' Choice

https://www.amazon.com/False-Report-True-Story-America/dp/1524759937


Help, Advice and Support

If you are a victim of sexual abuse you can contact:

National Rape Crisis Helpline in England and Wales 0808 802 9999 https://rapecrisis.org.uk/

National Sexual Assault Telephone Hotline USA 800.656.HOPE (4673) https://www.rainn.org/about-national-sexual-assault-telephone-hotline

Male Survivor in the USA https://www.malesurvivor.org/survivors/

Rape Treatment Center USA http://therapefoundation.org/

Peace Over Violence LA https://www.peaceoverviolence.org/
